definitions: Follow the course or trail of (someone or something).
Copy (a drawing, map, or design) by drawing over its lines on a superimposed piece of transparent paper.
Mark out or draw (a line, figure, or pattern).
Find evidence of something's past existence or occurrence.
examples: The detective traces the suspect's movements.
She traces her ancestry back to the 17th century.
He traces the image onto a new sheet.
The artist traces the outline of the figure.
The report traces the origins of the problem.
